sentences.sContent: A single candle illuminated his face.
sentences.sCn: 一支蜡烛照亮了他的脸。

sentences.sContent: The report illuminated the difficult issues at the heart of science policy.
sentences.sCn: 报告阐明了科学方针核心部分的难点。

sentences.sContent: ...race is understood to be a useful tool to illuminate human genetic diversity...
...data can illuminate patterns of behavior we haven't yet noticed...

synos.tran: 阐明，说明；照亮；使灿烂；用灯装饰

remMethod.val: il(表加强) ＋ lumin(光) ＋ ate → 加强光亮 → 照明

words.tran: 照亮的，照明的；启蒙的，有启发性的
照明；启发；兴奋（illuminate的过去分词）
照明，阐释（illuminate的现在分词形式）

trans.tranOther: to make a light shine on something, or to fill a place with light
